body: Built on top of #11403; I'll rebase once that's merged. Hint: you can select individual commits in the Files Changed tab. Checkbox does what you would expect. Press tab from the amount field to get there. It's unchecked by default unless you launch with `-addresstype=bech32`. QT generates new addresses by calling `addRow()` which seems a bit of a hack. I added a boolean argument to specify whether bech32 should be used. This makes the situation slightly worse, because this boolean has no meaning in the call from `editaddressdialog.cpp`. In fact, is it even possible for `mode` to be `NewReceivingAddress` there? The change in `receivecoinsdialog.ui` is smaller than it looks, due to the way git handles XML diffs. I had to add a horizontal spacer to make it look decent, see https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/11950#issuecomment-352870909. This causes column numbers to change in the rest of the grid. I recommend testing on at least one other OS than OSX to be on the safe side.
title: [qt] Receive: checkbox for bech32 address
